abstract: An article on the Square Feet pages on Wednesday about a boom in the construction of office towers in Calgary, Alberta, misstated the occupation of Richard White, a former official of the Downtown Association who commented on the bold designs of the city’s new buildings. He works as a business development, media and government liaison for an architecture firm, but he is not an architect.

lead_paragraph: An article on the Square Feet pages on Wednesday about a boom in the construction of office towers in Calgary, Alberta, misstated the occupation of Richard White, a former official of the Downtown Association who commented on the bold designs of the city’s new buildings. He works as a business development, media and government liaison for an architecture firm, but he is not an architect.
